title: Etherscan integrates ChatGPT to analyze Ethereum source code - crypto.news
summary: Etherscan, a popular Ethereum block explorer, has integrated ChatGPT to analyze Ethereum source code. The new tool, called Code Reader, uses ChatGPT's API to retrieve and interpret smart contract source code. This integration aims to streamline blockchain analysis and provide users with a more efficient way to understand Ethereum's source code. Other companies, such as Alchemy and Solana Labs, have also integrated ChatGPT for blockchain analysis. However, Etherscan emphasizes the limitations of ChatGPT and advises users to verify information independently. The tool is currently in beta and open to user feedback.

title: Ordinals Brought Inscriptions to Bitcoin—Now Ethscriptions Land on Ethereum - Decrypt
summary: Ethscriptions, a new protocol on Ethereum, allows users to create and share digital objects on the blockchain. Developed by Tom Lehman, the project saw explosive interest with nearly 30,000 creations in less than 18 hours. Ethscriptions enable non-financial data, including images, to be written into the main Ethereum blockchain using calldata, which is cheaper and more decentralized than using contract storage. The protocol guarantees global uniqueness of the content and has sparked interest from the NFT community, including a call from Adam McBride, an NFT archaeologist, to "ethscribed" famed NFT collection Crypto Punks. While the launch has seen significant interest, some have pointed out that the technology has been around for years and this is the first time it has gained widespread awareness.

title: Ethscriptions Launch on Ethereum Following Inscriptions on Bitcoin - Yahoo Finance
summary: Ethscriptions, a new protocol on Ethereum, allows users to create and share digital objects on the blockchain. It enables inscription of non-financial data under 96 kilobytes in size, particularly images, directly into the Ethereum main chain. The protocol gained significant traction with nearly 30,000 creations in less than 18 hours after launch, leveraging Ethereum "calldata" and considered cheaper and more decentralized than contract storage. While similar technology existed before, the widespread adoption of Ethscriptions marks a new trend in the Ethereum community's openness to innovation and experimentation. However, the debut of Ethscriptions experienced intermittent periods of downtime due to overwhelming interest from users. The longevity and impact of the protocol will be determined by ongoing community engagement and adoption.

title: Ethereum Addresses in Profit Tops 59% as Price Slip Deepens - CoinGape
summary:
Here is a summary of the article in 256 tokens or less:

Ethereum's price has slipped 0.60% to $1,741.24, extending losses over the past 7 days. Despite this, 57.5 million addresses are in profit, accounting for 59.66% of all active Ethereum addresses. Only 36.84 million addresses are in loss. The Ethereum Foundation is pushing for a Proof-of-Stake (PoS) upgrade, which could help the token's long-term prospects. Despite regulatory challenges, Ethereum is expected to outrank Bitcoin in the long term.

title: Ethereum takes the NFT stage by storm with Ethscriptions - AMBCrypto News
summary:
Sure, here is a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

Ethereum has launched a new feature called Ethscriptions, inspired by Bitcoin's inscriptions, which allows for the creation and sharing of digital works through Ethereum transaction data. The launch of Ethscriptions has garnered a favorable response, with 10,000 Ethereum punk inscriptions claimed within 24 hours. Ethereum dominates the NFT space, with blue-chip NFTs accounting for the top five NFTs by volume, sales, and market capitalization. The popularity of inscriptions could lead to an increase in transaction fees on the network. Despite the launch of Ethscriptions, the number of active addresses on the network remains relatively stable.

title: Cryptocurrency Price Today: Bitcoin Remains Above $26,000 Mark As Aptos Becomes Top Gainer - ABP Live
summary: Bitcoin (BTC) and Ethereum (ETH) prices rose above $26,000 and $17,000 marks, respectively, with minor gains across the board. Aptos (APT) emerged as the biggest gainer, up 9.97%, while Quant (QNT) turned out to be the biggest loser, down 10.87%. Other popular altcoins like Litecoin (LTC), Ripple (XRP), and Solana (SOL) also saw gains.

title: Ethereum Wading Through Unexplored Trails to Bounce Back - The Coin Republic
summary: Ethereum is expanding its reach in the Web3 gaming industry and NFT sector, which could help boost its value after a recent slump. The second-largest blockchain has seen significant growth in gaming protocols and NFTs, with an increase in gas usage and validators on the network. Despite a negative impact from FOMC announcements, gaming tokens have seen a significant increase in active addresses and transactions, leading to a positive impact on the network's overall volume. However, the sentiment regarding ETH is largely negative, with 52% of traders taking a short position. The current price coincides with EMA, but a weak RSI indicates a potential price correction.
